snippet: Scenes from a city rocked by a shock wave when a meteor hit the atmosphere offered a glimpse of an apocalyptic scenario that scientists said had never before hurt so many people.
abstract: Dense meteor hits Earth's atmosphere above northern Russia, disintegrating in a powerful explosion over Siberia; shock wave shatters massive amount of glass, injuring about 1,200 people, 200 of them children.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Viktor Klimenko contributed reporting from Moscow, Alan Cowell from London and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Scenes from a city rocked by a shock wave when a meteor hit the atmosphere offered a glimpse of an apocalyptic scenario that scientists said had never before hurt so many people.

headline.seo: Meteor Fragments Rain Down on Siberia; Hundreds of Injuries Reported
headline.main: Shock Wave of Fireball Meteor Rattles Siberia, Injuring 1,200
headline.print_headline: Meteor Explodes, Injuring Over 1,000 in Siberia
